TEI.2.document_title: Stephen F Austin to Conventional Committee, Unknown [Prior to 04-01-1833]

barker_notes.barker_summary: Address of central committee to convention, April 1, 1833. Reciting reasons for separation of Coahuila and Texas.
barker_notes.barker_footnotes: This address was written by Austin for the Central Committee appointed by the convention of October, 1832. It was presented to the convention of Apr. 1, 1833. A slightly different draft exists in the Austin Papers. Above, Ayuntamiento of San Felipe de Austin to the Fedeial Government. For a copy see Filisola, Memorias para la Historia de la Guerra de Texas, I, 273-293
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 934-940

*div1 type="summary"* *p*Address of central committee to convention, April 1, 1833. Reciting reasons for separation of Coahuila and Texas.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**person_mentioned*Gentlemen of the convention*/person_mentioned*,*/p*
*p*The *person_mentioned*central committee of safety and correspondence*/person_mentioned* which was established by the late convention, and by whose request the present convention has assembled, beg leave to offer their sincere congratulations on your arrival at the theatre where you are to exercise the high and important duties which devolve upon you as the *person_mentioned*representatives of the people of your several districts*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*Believing that your deliberations will be fraught with important results to the interests of our common country, the *person_mentioned*committee */person_mentioned*deem it a duty they owe you, as the *person_mentioned*delegates of the people*/person_mentioned* to make a brief exposition of the reasons which have operated on them in calling this convention, and in doing this, they wish it to be understood, not as attempting to dictate to this convention the course it should pursue in the least degree, nor to prescribed limits to its action, but to give a satisfactory explanation to you, and through you to the great body of the *person_mentioned*people of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*, of the causes which have impelled them to the exercise of this responsible duty.*/p*
*p*The situation of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*, is such as to give rise to great anxiety and even alarm in the heart of every person who inhabits it, or feels any interest for its prosperity or welfare.*/p*
*p*The whole of this *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*, with the exception of the small towns of *location_mentioned*Bexar */location_mentioned*and *location_mentioned*Goliad*/location_mentioned*, has been settled and redeemed from the *location_mentioned*wilderness */location_mentioned*within a few years by the enterprise of *person_mentioned*immigrants */person_mentioned*who removed to it in consequence of the express and earnest invitation of the *person_mentioned*Government*/person_mentioned*, contained in the national and state colonization laws. Those *person_mentioned*immigrants */person_mentioned*have uniformly evinced their gratitude to the *person_mentioned*government and *location_mentioned*nation */location_mentioned*of their adoption*/person_mentioned* for all the acts of kindness and liberality that have been extended towards them, and they have faithfully performed their duty as *person_mentioned*Mexican citizens*/person_mentioned*, and fulfilled the intention and spirit of the colonization laws, by settling the *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*, defending it from hostile *person_mentioned*indians*/person_mentioned*, or other *person_mentioned*enemies*/person_mentioned*, and developing its resources, thus giving value and character to a large section of the *location_mentioned*Mexican territory*/location_mentioned* which was before wild and almost unknown. They have introduced agriculture and the usefull arts and commerce, and if as has been said by a celebrated author " that man deserves well of his country who makes a blade of grass grow where none grew before ", how much more do the *person_mentioned*people of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned* */person_mentioned*deserve from their *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*who have so materially added to the national grandeur, phisical force and resources. The *person_mentioned*people of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned* */person_mentioned*ought therefore to rely with confidence on the *person_mentioned*government */person_mentioned*for protection, and to expect that an adequate remedy will be applied to the many evils that are afflicting them.*/p*
*p*The invitations in virtue of which they came here, and the guarantees of the constitution and laws, evidently contain a pledge on the part of the government, that they should be governed in accordance with the spirit of the free political institutions of the *location_mentioned*Mexican republic*/location_mentioned*, and in the manner best adapted to the local situation and necessities of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*. The right of the people of Texas to represent their wants to the government, and to explain in a respectfull man- ner the remedies that will relieve them cannot therefore be doubted or questioned. It is not merely a right, it is also a sacred and bounden duty which they owe to themselves and to the whole *location_mentioned*Mexican nation*/location_mentioned*, for should evils of great and desolating magnitude fall upon *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*for the want of competent remedies, the people here would have cause to accuse themselves of neglect for not making an effort to procure such remedies, and the government would also have cause to complain, that a full and frank and timely representation had not been made and a remedy solicited.*/p*
*p*It is very evident that these considerations have influenced the *person_mentioned*people of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* in all they have done up to the present time. They have been governed by the desire to do their duty faithfully to the *location_mentioned*Mexican nation*/location_mentioned* and to themselves. In the discharge of this duty the people and *person_mentioned*civil authorities of *location_mentioned*Austins Colony*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* made a respectfull and humble petition to the General and *person_mentioned*State governments*/person_mentioned* on the *date_mentioned n="02-18-1832">18 day of Feby 1832*/date_mentioned* setting forth the evils that were afflicting this *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*. The *person_mentioned*inhabitants */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*civil authorities of *location_mentioned*Bexar*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*, the *location_mentioned*ancient and present capital of Texas*/location_mentioned*, also made a very able and energetic represention on the same subject on the *date_mentioned n="12-19-1832">19th of December last*/date_mentioned*,2 Numerous other *person_mentioned*representatives */person_mentioned*have been made at various times by all the *person_mentioned*Ayuntamientos of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*, and on the *date_mentioned n="10-01-1832">first of October last*/date_mentioned* *person_mentioned*delegates of the people of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* met in convention at this *location_mentioned*Town*/location_mentioned* and unanimously resolved that it was expedient that the political union between *location_mentioned*Coahuila */location_mentioned*and *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*should be dissolved and that *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*should be organised as a *location_mentioned*separate State of the Mexican confederation*/location_mentioned* as soon as the approbation of the *person_mentioned*General government */person_mentioned*to that effect could be obtained. That convention accordingly memorialised *person_mentioned*congress */person_mentioned*on the subject, and elected an *person_mentioned*agent */person_mentioned*to go to *location_mentioned*Mexico */location_mentioned*in order to forward the views of the *person_mentioned*people of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* in obtaining the sanction of the *person_mentioned*general government*/person_mentioned*. But the continuation of the intestine commotions which have raged within the bosom of the *location_mentioned*Mexican republic*/location_mentioned* for more than twelve months past, and which threaten'd a total overthrow of the established institutions of the country, prevented the memorial from being presented in accordance with the intentions of the *date_mentioned n="10-xx-1832">October */date_mentioned*convention.*/p*
*p*That convention adopted many other memorials and resolutions, amongst the most important of which was the provisional organization of the *person_mentioned*militia*/person_mentioned*, as a precaution against contemplated attacks upon our *location_mentioned*exposed frontier*/location_mentioned* by the many tribes of hostile *person_mentioned*indians */person_mentioned*who inhabit the *location_mentioned*northern and western parts of Texas*/location_mentioned*; and the establishment of the *person_mentioned*central and sub-committees of safety and correspondence*/person_mentioned* throughout the *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*all of which were rendered inoperative by the decree of the *person_mentioned*governor of the *location_mentioned*state of Coahuila and Texas*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*, who declared the proceedings of the convention null and void, and ordered the several *person_mentioned*committees */person_mentioned*to dissolve.*/p*
*p*At the time when this *person_mentioned*committee */person_mentioned*determined to convoke the present convention, they took an impartial survey of our federal relations and of our local affairs.*/p*
*p*They beheld the *location_mentioned*Mexican confederation*/location_mentioned* torn and broken asunder by *person_mentioned*political parties*/person_mentioned* each of which sustained its pretentions to the *person_mentioned*supreme executive power of the nation*/person_mentioned* by force of arms. Civil war raged in every part of the *location_mentioned*Mexican territory*/location_mentioned* and in looking upon the face of the nation nothing was to be seen but confusion and bloody discord—Brother contending with brother in deadly strife for mastery in political power. They saw that the constitution of the *location_mentioned*republic*/location_mentioned*, that instrument which they had been taught to look upon as the sacred charter of their liberties was alternately violated and set aside by all parties, and that all the constitutional guarantees were merged for the time being in military power. They saw the constitutional period for the election of *person_mentioned*President */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*vice President of the *location_mentioned*nation*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* and of *person_mentioned*members of Congress*/person_mentioned*, pass by, and at least *location_mentioned*one third of the states*/location_mentioned* refuse or neglect to hold the elections. The future presented the gloomy prospect that the days of constitutional freedom had been numbered to the *person_mentioned*Mexicans*/person_mentioned*, and that we should ere long see the waves of anarchy and confusion close forever over the wreck of that *location_mentioned*Mexican republic*/location_mentioned*. The disorganization of the government was so extreem, that even the *person_mentioned*leaders of the liberal party */person_mentioned*who have been contending for the restoration of constitutional liberty, and whose cause was espoused by the *person_mentioned*people of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*, and generously defended with their blood and treasure, found themselves conpelled to lay aside all the established forms, and to renovate the constitution by violent and unconstitutional means.*/p*
*p*The *person_mentioned*committee */person_mentioned*turned from this view of our national affairs to that of the local internal situation of *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*which has not materially changed since the last convention. The political system under which *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*has heretofore been governed, tends to check the growth of the *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*, and to produce confusion and insecurity, rather than to extend protection to lives liberty and property. The unnatural annexation of what was formerly the*location_mentioned* province of Texas*/location_mentioned* to *location_mentioned*Coahuila*/location_mentioned* by the constituent *person_mentioned*congress of the *location_mentioned*Mexican nation*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*, has forced upon the *person_mentioned*people of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* a system of laws which they do not understand and which cannot be administered so as to suit their condition or to supply their wants.*/p*
*p*The *person_mentioned*Alcaldes */person_mentioned*who are the highest *person_mentioned*judicial officers in *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* and have unlimited jurisdiction in all cases, are elected annually by the people, and those who are ignorant and corrupt and without re- sponsibiliiy are as liable to be chosen as the wise, the virtuous and the responsible. This remark is justified by the fact that the office is without emolument and is extreemly burdensome, and will therefore seldom be sought by those who are best qualified to fill it. In all civil cases there is an appeal to the *person_mentioned*supreme tribunal of the state at *location_mentioned*Saltillo*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* a distance of near seven hundred miles from the inhabited parts of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*. There are but few *person_mentioned*men */person_mentioned*in *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*who are qualified to prepare cases for the *person_mentioned*supreme court*/person_mentioned* and when appeals have been taken they have generally been sent back several times to be reformed so that decissions in such cases are seldom had. It has become proverbial in *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*, that an appeal to *location_mentioned*Saltillo */location_mentioned*is a payment of the debt. It amounts to a total denial of justice especially to the poor, and this is the frail tenure by which the most important rights of the *person_mentioned*people of *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*are suspended.*/p*
*p*The manner of trying *person_mentioned*culprits */person_mentioned*for high criminal offences is such that it amounts to no tryal at all. The tryal by *person_mentioned*jury */person_mentioned*is not sanctioned by law, and the rights of the accused are committed to an *person_mentioned*alcalde*/person_mentioned* who is ignorant of the formulas of the laws, and of the language in which they are written who prepares the cause for the judgment of the *person_mentioned*supreme tribunal in *location_mentioned*Saltillo*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*, thus the lives, liberty and honor of the *person_mentioned*accused */person_mentioned*are suspended upon the tardy decission of a distant *person_mentioned*tribunal */person_mentioned*which knows not nor cares not for his suffering, and the rights of the *location_mentioned*community */location_mentioned*to bring *person_mentioned*offenders */person_mentioned*to speedy and exemplary punishment are sacrificed to forms equally uncertain and unknown. The formula required by law in the prosecution of *person_mentioned*criminals */person_mentioned*is so difficult to be pursued that most of the *location_mentioned*courts in Texas*/location_mentioned* have long since ceased to attempt its execution. The tryal by *person_mentioned*jury */person_mentioned*has been attempted in some of the *location_mentioned*municipalities*/location_mentioned*, but being unsupported by the sanction of law it also has failed of success. A total interegnum in the administration of justice in criminal cases may be said to exist. A total disregard of the laws has become so prevalent, both amongst the *person_mentioned*officers of justice*/person_mentioned*, and the *person_mentioned*people */person_mentioned*at large, that reverence for laws or for those who administer them has almost intirely disappeared and contempt is fast assuming its place, so that the protection of our property- our persons and lives is circumscribed almost exclusively to the moral honesty or virtue of our neighbor.*/p*
*p*The people and *person_mentioned*authorities of *location_mentioned*Bexar*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* in their representation in *date_mentioned n="12-xx-1832">December last*/date_mentioned* speaking of the judiciary system in *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*use the following strong and conclusive language.*/p*
*p*"In the judiciary department there never has been any adequate organization and it may be said with just cause that in this department there is not and never has been any government in *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*."*/p*
*p*Besides the evils which menace *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*for the want of a judiciary there are others of no less appalling effects. This *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*is in danger of being inundated by bands of *person_mentioned*northern Indians*/person_mentioned* who are removing from the *location_mentioned*east side of the Mississippi*/location_mentioned* to *location_mentioned*Arkansas */location_mentioned*on our *location_mentioned*borders*/location_mentioned*. Also the *person_mentioned*Comanche*/person_mentioned*, *person_mentioned*Tahuacana */person_mentioned*and other tribes of *person_mentioned*native Texas indians*/person_mentioned* have recently become hostile and are committing depredations on the *location_mentioned*frontiers*/location_mentioned*. But [it] is unnecessary to enter into details—enough is said in the representation of *location_mentioned*Bexar */location_mentioned*by the declaration that there is not and never has been any adequate govt in *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*Judging from the past, it must be considered a vain hope to look to the *person_mentioned*State government of *location_mentioned*Coahuila and Texas*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* for a redress of grievances, or a remedy of wrongs. We have twice beheld the mortifying spectacle of the *person_mentioned*corrupt mob of the Capital*/person_mentioned* driving the *person_mentioned*legislature */person_mentioned*by force to adopt measures, unconstitutional in themselves, insulting to the *person_mentioned*inhabitants of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*, and disregardful of their rights, The general neglect of the *person_mentioned*state Legislature*/person_mentioned* of all the important interests and rights of *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*and their repeated violations of the constitution are very clearly and energetically set forth in the *location_mentioned*Bexar */location_mentioned*remonstrance of *date_mentioned n="12-xx-1832">last December*/date_mentioned*. There seems to be no cause to expect any favourable change towards *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*in the politics of *location_mentioned*Coahuila*/location_mentioned*. But even supposing there were the *person_mentioned*legislature*/person_mentioned* that would suit *location_mentioned*Coahuila */location_mentioned*would be pernicious in *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*. No organization can be devised under the constitution of the *location_mentioned*State of Coahuila and Texas*/location_mentioned* that would suit the two extremes, separated as they are more than 400 leagues, a great part through a *location_mentioned*wilderness */location_mentioned*that cannot be passed without imminent danger from hostile *person_mentioned*indians*/person_mentioned*, The dissimilarity of habits occupation and language also present still greater difficulties than the distance. These difficulties are hard to reconcile for the reason that the state constitution requires that all general laws shall be the same throughout the whole state, There cannot therefore be any organization of the judiciary for *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*materially different from that of *location_mentioned*Coahuila*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*In this state of things the *person_mentioned*committee */person_mentioned*considered themselves bound by a solemn duty to call on the *person_mentioned*people of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* through their *person_mentioned*representatives */person_mentioned*to meet in general convention with full powers to deliberate on the present distracted situation of our infant *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*and to adopt such constitutional measures as in their wisdom they may deem necessary In exercising this highly responsible duty the *person_mentioned*committee */person_mentioned*did not act unadvisedly or without the most mature deliberation, and they did not call this convention untill they were satisfied that a large majority of the*person_mentioned* people of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* were in favor of applying for a well organized state Govt as the only remedy for existing evils.*/p*
*p*The law of the constituent *person_mentioned*Congress */person_mentioned*of*date_mentioned n="05-07-1824"> 7 May 1824*/date_mentioned* evidently contemplates that *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*should form a *location_mentioned*separate State*/location_mentioned* The 2d article of that law is in the following words as translated " *location_mentioned*Coahuila and Texas*/location_mentioned* shall also form another state, but so soon as the latter is in a situation to figure as a *location_mentioned*separate state*/location_mentioned*, it shall inform *person_mentioned*congress*/person_mentioned* thereof for its resolution."*/p*
*p*The right which this law confers upon the *person_mentioned*people of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* to inform *person_mentioned*congress */person_mentioned*when they are in a situation to figure as a State, and to apply for admission into the *location_mentioned*Union */location_mentioned*is certainly very clear and unequivocal.*/p*
*p*What method may be the best to obtain a remedy for the many evils which afflict *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*, can only be determined by the wisdom of the *person_mentioned*convention*/person_mentioned*. Trusting that your deliberations will be conducted with that zeal for the public welfare which the common good of our *location_mentioned*adopted country*/location_mentioned* requires and that they will tend to that happy issue which all so confidently anticipate, the *person_mentioned*central committee*/person_mentioned* take leave of the convention by depositing the power which they have exercised for a time in the hands of those who gave it.*/p*
*/div1*
